definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom

sentences.english: Wear an open shirt, and touch your neck and collarbone.
sentences.chinese: 穿一件開襟襯衫，撫摸自己的脖子和鎖骨。

sentences.english: Cardigan A snazzy sweater instantly dresses up any outfit.
sentences.chinese: 開襟毛衣一件時髦的毛衣可以立即打亮整套造型。

sentences.english: I like to wear my red cardigan.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡穿我的那件紅開襟絨線衫。

sentences.english: Manufacturing methods of garment top fly pattern are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了服裝開襟紙樣製作的方法。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
